events.text:
Modern conceptions on dreams are pretty, well, modern.
In fact, for a very long time, it was believed dreams were revelations of truths, or some form of divine messages.
Science, because of its aversion to the supernatural and undemonstrable, goes against that idea.
And, well...
Science essentially built the modern world. The technological innovations which shape and have shaped the Earth for centuries came about due to prior scientific research.
But science is kind of failing you right now.
And science is not the only respected area of knowledge. There is an ancient philosophical argument, that the existence of dreams, and the way we experience consciousness within, could be an indication that our real world is a dream.
Maybe reality is just, a really deep well of dreams stacked on top of dreams.
That's scary. And it's scary that you can't prove it wrong.
Science dismisses what cannot be proven wrong... But then again, science is failing you.
The idea that... The consciousness you experience when dreaming is not your own is scary.
